ty a lot raster!

Raster.

What does `Half` Side By Side means tho?

And also is that shown on full screen or 16:9 on the 3dtv?

dammit raster i got 2 huge 3d movies this one and dark country and i cant get either to play sound.  my other mkv files play fine and can stream to my ps 3 but this shit gives me unsupported data errors all over.  Wtf is different about the codec you are using.  I installed cccp pack, no good.  k lite, no good.  I even went to mastroska.org and got a diag tool to check your shit and the proper splitter for mkv is not detected.  how the fuck did you make this bogus shit?

@ neomorphic805

I understand pall. I have had the same prob with other films. Its the sound channel of your codec/player

Power DVD is a good player you can use to watch from pc to TV. I tend to get the problem when thers more than one language in the film.

I dont have a ps3 now days so can not test on one for you pall. But thry changeing sound channel and you shuld be fine :D

Hands down, Power DVD 10 is the best video player to play with without any loss in quality. I have watched some DL 3D videos on the PS3 and was less then satified. Only 3D bluerays play well on it. 3D is best done on the PC.

It might be a protection thing... with the no sound. I downloaded this and after a few minutes I got an error saying it was going to mute the movie due to it being a copy. I was playing it on my PS3. Anyways, yeah it's called a Cinavia protection I think.
